participant_1.name: Laura
participant_1.personality: Reflective and introspective, Laura often contemplates her life choices and seeks deeper fulfillment beyond her daily responsibilities.
participant_1.background: I have a friend group, but I don’t like any of them. I coexist well with my husband. My days are filled with cross country tryouts and basketball practice. I am a middle-aged mother of two high school boys. But, I feel lost and far away from who I truly am.

participant_2.name: Ethan
participant_2.personality: Empathetic and supportive, Ethan enjoys connecting with others and is always willing to lend a listening ear to those in need.
participant_2.background: I enjoy going to festivals. I eat meat. My favorite band is The Story So Far. I recently started working online. My friends don’t call me by my real name.

content.text: I feel like I'm lost and far away from who I truly am.
I'm sorry to hear that. What's making you feel that way?
I don't know. I just feel like I'm not living my life to the fullest. I have a good job, a great husband, and two amazing sons, but I'm still not happy.
It sounds like you're feeling a bit unfulfilled. Is there anything you can do to change that?
I don't know. I've tried to talk to my husband about it, but he doesn't seem to understand. He thinks I'm just being silly.
Maybe you need to talk to someone else. A therapist or counselor could help you figure out what you need to do to be happier.
I've thought about that, but I'm not sure I can afford it.
There are some free and low-cost options available. You could also try talking to a friend or family member who you trust.
I'll think about it. Thanks for listening.
You're welcome. I'm here for you if you need anything.
